review_title: Unique and interesting place to work.
pros:
Good place to work for with good overall job perks including a generous 90% discount off ticket prices with the airline as well as any other airline within the One World Alliance leading to endless possibilities to travel the world in our spare time. 

Lots of opportunities also exist to participate in charitable projects and Marketing and PR events to broaden horizons and enhance employee experience.
cons: Promotion for work becoming a little slow and career progression not possible until whenever the company needs to fill positions. This usually takes many years. Hard work from employees need more recognition.

pros: If you are looking for a relatively stable environment, fairly good salary and fringe benefits (but not the top), working for a reputable multinational company, you should consider Cathay Pacific as one of your choices. Being a staff, you would also be able to learn more about British style of management, how one of the most difficult businesses is run successfully (Cathay Pacific Airways has won numerous awards and is regarded one of the best airlines, if not the best), how budgets are controlled, how the management pushes the staff to improve productivity continuously and how to retain people.  Cathay Pacific used to favor expatriates, especially British for their Executive Trainees program. However, since the handover of Hong Kong to China, this has been changed.
cons: It would not be a good place for high-flyers.
